CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 3, 1946, pg. 3, reads: "[illegible] ...Protest Strike - Employees at the Pittsburgh... of Jones and Laughlin Steel Corporation... a "bias protest strike" Monday morning which... in an investigation by the corporation and ... officials to determine the extent of job discrimination. Key figures in controversy are pictured in front of the Steelworkers union office on the... Side.  Left to right; back row are: Harold..., shop steward; Wilbur Smith, Harry Rowczka, president of Local 1843; Boyd L. Wilson, international representative for the Steelworkers of America; Sam Bealich, staff representative of District 16; Charles Washington, Industrial Relations Secretary of the Urban League; Raymond Glenn, Charles Winbush, also a shop steward; John O'Brien, zone committeeman of the local.  Kneeling are Peter Charles and Ted Mathos, general committeeman of the local."
TitMainTitle: Steelworkers including Harold, Wilbur Smith, Harry Rowczka, Boyd L. Wilson, Sam Bealich, Charles Washington, Raymond Glenn, Charles Winbush, John O'Brien, and Peter Charles and Ted Mathos kneeling in front, outside United Steelworkers of America headquarters, 2716 Sarah Street, South Side
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Steel industry and trade--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Strikes and lockouts Steel industry.United Steelworkers of America.
